New Year's holiday dinners

Events and specials at area restaurants for New Year's holiday

New Year's holiday dinners

Dana McMahan, Special to The Courier-Journal 10:39 a.m. EST December 22, 2014

Holiday dinners and more at Louisville area restaurants(Photo: Provided)

CONNECT 1 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

Dec. 25

The Sea Hag at the Village Anchor, 11507 Park Road in Anchorage, will be open Christmas Day evening from 7 to 11 p.m. with light food and a full bar.

Dec. 31

MilkWood, 316 W. Main St., will serve a special New Year's dinner option whole roast BBQ suckling pig and whole Chinese-style roast ducks. The meats will be presented on the bar, carved and brought to tables family-style; $28 for the roast meat platter; splits of Lamberti Prosecco Extra Dry available just that night $15 a bottle; $2 shots of Rebel Yell. milkwoodrestaurant.com

The Bristol Bar and Grille downtown, 614 W. Main St., will offer a New Year's Eve four-course Pappy dinner, which includes a bourbon flight featuring 12-year-old Van Winkle Special Reserve as well as the Pappy Van Winkle 15-, 20- and 23-year-olds; $100, plus tax and tip; seating is available from 5 to 10 p.m. bristolbarandgrille.com.

COURIER-JOURNAL

Louisville restaurant review | Gasthaus gives plenty of reasons to indulge

Brasserie Provence, 150 N. Hurstbourne Parkway, will offer two seatings for their New Year's Eve prix fixe menu: $44 for three courses at 5 p.m. and $74 for five courses at 8 p.m.; the evening features disco music and dancing. http://brasserieprovence.com/

Jan. 1

Proof on Main, 702 W. Main St., will host a New Year's Day hangover brunch, with a la carte options and drink specials from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. www.proofonmain.com

Tell Dana! Send your restaurant "dish" to Dana McMahan at thecjdish@gmail.com and follow @danamac on Twitter.
